methodology.framework: Comparative mythology + I Ching-based Human Design system
academic_foundations: I Ching (64 hexagrams â†’ 64 Human Design gates)
Cross-cultural star mythology (Greek, Aboriginal, Indigenous, Hindu)
methodology.source_standards: Ancient texts with named translators, published books with ISBNs, evidence typing (direct/inferred/symbolic), consensus levels documented. V4: Uses provisional (location_hint + summary) vs locked (page + quote) citation status. Optimized for fully accessible online sources. Relaxed trait coverage for low-consensus characteristics.

human_design_foundations: I Ching - 3,000+ years of scholarship (Wilhelm, Legge, Jung)
64 DNA codons - Nobel Prize research (Nirenberg, Khorana 1968)
Chakra system - Religious Studies, Yoga Studies
mathematical_correspondences: Binary yin/yang logic = Binary genetic code (A/T, C/G)

characteristics.trait: Seven Sisters as universal feminine collective and nurturers

sources.title: Metamorphoses
sources.author: Ovid
sources.quote: My mother is one of the seven sisters, the Pleiades. Great Atlas, who carries the axis of the heavens on his shoulders

sources.title: The Library
sources.author: Apollodorus
sources.quote: Atlas and Pleione, daughter of Ocean, had seven daughters called the Pleiades born to them at Cyllene in Arcadia

sources.title: The Mahabharata
sources.author: Vyasa
sources.quote: the Krittikas took place on that same White Mountain the sensual indulgences of the Fire-god with the Krittikas

sources.title: The Seven Sisters of the Pleiades: Stories from Around the World
sources.author: Munya Andrews
sources.summary: Cross-cultural examination of Seven Sisters motif showing universal nurturing and feminine archetypal patterns across cultures

sources.title: Works and Days
sources.author: Hesiod
sources.quote: When the Pleiades, daughters of Atlas, are rising, begin your harvest, and your ploughing when they are going to set

sources.title: Matariki: The Star of the Year
sources.author: Rangi Matamua
sources.location_hint: Chapters on Matariki New Year and seasonal marking
sources.summary: Pleiades rising marks Maori New Year and agricultural planting time, traditional seasonal calendar marker

sources.title: The Seven Sisters of the Pleiades: Stories from Around the World
sources.author: Munya Andrews
sources.location_hint: Chapter on agricultural and seasonal uses across cultures
sources.summary: Documents Pleiades use as agricultural calendar markers in Aboriginal Australian Indigenous Greek and other cultures globally

characteristics.trait: Emotional healers and teachers of compassion (modern channeled)

sources.title: Bringers of the Dawn: Teachings from the Pleiadians
sources.author: Barbara Marciniak
sources.location_hint: Chapter 5 on love and healing; multiple chapters on emotional transformation
sources.summary: Pleiadians described as teachers of love compassion and emotional healing helping humanity embrace feeling and heart-centered awareness

sources.title: The Pleiadian Agenda: A New Cosmology for the Age of Light
sources.author: Barbara Hand Clow
sources.location_hint: Throughout, discussing nine-dimensional healing and emotional awakening
sources.summary: Pleiadians presented as multidimensional guides facilitating emotional spiritual healing and compassionate evolution of consciousness

sources.title: The Pleiadian Workbook: Awakening Your Divine Ka
sources.author: Amorah Quan Yin
sources.location_hint: Chapters on energetic healing practices and emotional clearing techniques
sources.summary: Pleiadian teachings focused on opening Ka Channels for emotional healing vibratory balance and stimulating heart-based emotional transformation

sources.title: The Mahabharata
sources.author: Vyasa
sources.quote: The Krittikas took the child and became the nurses of Kartikeya providing motherly nourishment

sources.title: Works and Days
sources.author: Hesiod

sources.title: The Seven Sisters of the Pleiades: Stories from Around the World
sources.author: Munya Andrews
sources.location_hint: Chapters on Aboriginal Australian Dreamtime and Seven Sisters mythology
sources.summary: Aboriginal Seven Sisters represent ancestral women divine feminine energy and women's law and ceremony across Australian cultures

sources.title: The Library
sources.author: Apollodorus
sources.location_hint: Book 3, Section 10, in descriptions of Pleiades mythology
sources.summary: Pleiades described as virgin companions of Artemis pursued by Orion until Zeus transformed them to stars

sources.title: Star Myths of the Greeks and Romans: A Sourcebook
sources.author: Theony Condos
sources.summary: Documents Greek tradition of Pleiades as Artemis companions and their transformation to stars to escape Orion

characteristics.trait: Symbol of unity and togetherness (Japanese Subaru)

sources.title: Harima Fudoki: A Record of Ancient Japan Reinterpreted, Translated, Annotated, and with Commentary
sources.author: Traditional compilation
sources.location_hint: Analysis sections on Pleiades Subaru references and star cluster mythology
sources.summary: Japanese term Subaru meaning unite or clustered refers to Pleiades representing unity and collective harmony in ancient Japanese texts

sources.title: A Japanese Myth of the Origin of the Pleiades
sources.author: Edwina Palmer
sources.location_hint: Analysis of Harima Fudoki Pleiades references and Subaru meaning
sources.summary: Analyzes Japanese Pleiades mythology showing Subaru constellation represents unity togetherness and clustered stars working as collective

characteristics.trait: Cross-cultural pursuit motif (Orion chasing Seven Sisters)

sources.title: The Astronomy Fragment 4
sources.author: Hesiod
sources.location_hint: Fragment discussing Orion and the Pleiades
sources.summary: Orion pursued the Pleiades in company with Artemis and Leto on Crete in Greek astronomical mythology

sources.title: The Seven Sisters of the Pleiades: Stories from Around the World
sources.author: Munya Andrews
sources.location_hint: Chapters comparing Greek Aboriginal and global pursuit myths
sources.summary: Documents remarkably similar Seven Sisters pursuit myths across Greek Aboriginal Australian and other cultures showing ancient cross-cultural pattern

cross_cultural_patterns.pattern: Seven Sisters motif across multiple continents
cross_cultural_patterns.consensus: Universal recognition of Pleiades as seven female entities associated with nurturing, seasonal cycles, and feminine wisdom

sources.title: The Seven Sisters of the Pleiades: Stories from Around the World
sources.author: Munya Andrews
sources.location_hint: Throughout book comparative analysis of Seven Sisters across cultures
sources.summary: Comprehensive cross-cultural study documenting Seven Sisters pattern in Greek Aboriginal Maori Cherokee Maya Hindu and other traditions

sources.title: Why Are There Seven Sisters?
sources.author: Ray Norris and Barnaby Norris
sources.location_hint: Chapter examining cross-cultural Seven Sisters patterns
sources.summary: Analyzes remarkable similarity of Seven Sisters myths across vastly separated cultures including Aboriginal and Greek suggesting great antiquity

research_notes: This research establishes strong foundational characteristics for the Pleiades based on ancient texts, indigenous traditions, and modern channeled sources. HIGH consensus found for: (1) Seven Sisters as universal feminine collective and nurturers (4 sources: 3 locked ancient, 1 provisional research), (2) Agricultural/seasonal markers (3 sources: 1 locked ancient, 2 provisional), (3) Feminine energy and divine mothers (4 sources: 2 locked ancient, 1 provisional indigenous). MEDIUM consensus for Artemis companions and Japanese unity symbolism. LOW consensus but well-documented for emotional healing theme in modern channeled material (3 provisional sources). Cross-cultural Seven Sisters pattern is exceptionally strong with documentation from Greek, Hindu, Aboriginal Australian, Maori, Cherokee, Maya, and Japanese traditions. Locked citations (7 total) include Ovid Metamorphoses, Apollodorus Library, Hesiod Works and Days, and Mahabharata. Provisional citations (13 total) primarily for modern research books and channeled sources. Ancient support is HIGH for nurturing, feminine, and seasonal characteristics; UNKNOWN for modern emotional healing themes. This represents Phase 0 baseline research providing solid scaffold for future verification of provisional citations.

ancient_texts: Apollodorus - The Library (J. G. Frazer translation, 1921)
Hesiod - Works and Days (Hugh G. Evelyn-White translation, 1914)
modern_research: Andrews, M. (2004). The Seven Sisters of the Pleiades: Stories from Around the World. Spinifex Press. ISBN 9781876756451
Matamua, R. (2017). Matariki: The Star of the Year. Huia Publishers. ISBN 9781775503255
Condos, T. (1997). Star Myths of the Greeks and Romans. Phanes Press. ISBN 9781890482930
Palmer, E. (2010). A Japanese Myth of the Origin of the Pleiades. Asian Ethnology
Norris, R. & Norris, B. (2020). Why Are There Seven Sisters? Springer
channeled_sources: Marciniak, B. (1992). Bringers of the Dawn: Teachings from the Pleiadians. Bear & Company. ISBN 9780939680986

Quan Yin, A. (1996). The Pleiadian Workbook: Awakening Your Divine Ka. Bear & Company. ISBN 9781879181311

Nirenberg, M.W. & Khorana, H.G. (1968). Genetic Code Research (Nobel Prize)
